plan:
1. Initial Rounds (1-5): Bid aggressively, matching my value to gather data on other bidders' tendencies and calculate average winning bids.

2. Middle Rounds (6-10): Experiment with bidding strategies. Bid slightly above the average winning bid if my value permits. Also, test low bids when my value is low to conserve resources.

Plan:

1. Initial Rounds (1-3): Bid low (10-20% of value) to gather data on competitors' bidding patterns without risking high losses.

2. Mid Rounds (4-9): Increase bids to 30-60% of value based on competitors' strategies. If they bid aggressively, stay conservative. If they're conservative, bid aggressively.

3. Late Rounds (10-15): Based on data, finalize strategy. If winning frequently, maintain aggressive bidding. If not, consider riskier bids (70-90% of value) to potentially secure higher profits.

1. Initial Rounds (1-3): Bid low (10-20% of value), gather data on competitors' bidding behavior.
2. Middle Rounds (4-7): Bid aggressively (80-100% of value), test reactions and potential for profit.
3. Late Middle Rounds (8-11): Bid moderately (40-60% of value), assess balance between risk and reward.

Continue aggressive bidding to gather data in early rounds. Experiment with slightly lower bids than my value in the next rounds to potentially increase profit. Observe other bidders' patterns and adjust my strategy accordingly.
Plan:

Continue with initial strategy of bidding low. Analyze Andy and Betty's bidding behavior: if they bid high consistently, consider bidding aggressively when my value is high. If they bid low, maintain a moderate bidding strategy. Adapt tactics based on observed patterns and current round value.

Continue aggressive bidding in early rounds for data collection. Gradually decrease bids in relation to my value to increase profitability. Observe other bidders' patterns and adjust my strategy accordingly. Experiment with low bids when my value is low to conserve resources.

Plan: Continue with low bids (10-20% of value) for data collection. Analyze competitors' patterns to identify their strategy. Gradually increase bids in mid rounds (30-60% of value) to test competitiveness without risking high losses.

Continue observing competitors' bidding behavior. If they consistently bid high, adopt a high-risk strategy by bidding aggressively when my value is high. If they bid low, maintain a moderate strategy. Adapt tactics based on observed patterns and current round value.

Plan for next rounds: Continue aggressive bidding in early rounds. Gradually decrease bids in relation to my value to increase profitability. Experiment with low bids when my value is low to conserve resources. Adjust strategy based on other bidders' patterns. Aim to maximize profit margins.

Plan: Continue low bids (10-20% of value) in round 3 for data collection. In rounds 4-6, increase bids to 40-60% of value, assessing competitors' strategies. In final rounds, consider aggressive bidding (70-90% of value) if not winning frequently to maximize potential profit.

Plan for next rounds: Observe Andy and Betty's bidding patterns. If they bid high, employ a risky strategy, bidding 90-100% of value on high-value rounds. If they bid low, adopt a moderate approach, bidding 40-60% of value. Adjust strategy based on round value and observed patterns.

For the next rounds, I will reduce my bid by 10% from my value to increase profit while maintaining a competitive edge. I'll also try bidding significantly lower when my value is low to conserve resources. I will continue observing other bidders' patterns and adjust my strategy accordingly.

Plan: Gradually increase bids to 30-50% of value in rounds 4-6. Analyze competitors' bidding patterns. If they bid conservatively, bid aggressively. If not winning frequently by round 7, consider riskier bids of 70-90% value to maximize potential profit.

For the next rounds, I will employ a mixed strategy. I will bid aggressively (80-100% of value) during high-value rounds, and bid moderately (40-60% of value) during low-value rounds. I will also incorporate random low bids to confuse competitors.

For the next rounds, I will test a strategy of bidding my value minus 20% to increase profit margins. I will also experiment with bidding very low when my value is below $30 to minimize losses. I will continue observing other bidders' strategies and adjust accordingly.

Plan: Continue bidding 30-50% of value for rounds 5-6, analyzing competitors' strategies. If they bid aggressively, maintain current strategy. If losing frequently by round 7, bid aggressively (70-90% of value) to potentially maximize profit. Adjust strategy based on data from each round.

Next rounds: Continue mixed strategy, bid aggressively (80-100% of value) during high-value rounds, moderately (40-60% of value) during low-value rounds. Introduce occasional low bids (10-20% of value) to confuse competitors. Adjust strategy based on competitors' patterns and round value.

For the next rounds, I'll bid aggressively when my value is above $70, but bid my value minus 30% when it's between $30 and $70. For values below $30, I'll bid very low to minimize losses. I'll continue analyzing other bidders' strategies.

Plan: Continue bidding 30-50% of value for round 6. Adjust strategy based on competitor's patterns. If not winning frequently by round 7, increase bids to 70-90% of value to potentially maximize profit. Adapt strategy based on data from each round.

Continue mixed strategy: bid aggressively on high-value rounds (70-90% of value), moderately on low-value rounds (30-50% of value). Introduce occasional low bids (10-20% of value) for unpredictability. Adjust strategy based on competitors' patterns and round value. Aim to slightly undercut my value on high-value rounds.

For the next rounds, I'll bid aggressively when my value is above $70, bid my value minus 40% when it's between $30 and $70, and bid very low for values below $30. I'll continue analyzing other bidders' strategies and adjust accordingly.

Plan: Continue bidding 30-50% of value for round 7. Analyze competitors' patterns. If consistently losing, increase bids to 70-90% of value for rounds 8-10. Reassess strategy for final rounds based on results. Aim to balance risk and potential profit.

I will continue with my mixed strategy but with slight adjustments. For high-value rounds, I'll bid 70-90% of value. For low-value rounds, I'll bid 20-40% of value. I'll also randomly bid low (5-10% of value) for unpredictability. I'll adjust based on competitors' patterns.

For the next rounds, I'll bid my value when it's above $80. For values between $40 and $80, I'll bid 60% of my value. For values below $40, I'll bid very low to minimize losses. I'll continue to monitor other bidders' strategies.

Plan: Continue bidding 30-50% of value for round 8. Analyze competitors' patterns. If consistently losing, increase bids to 70-90% of value for rounds 9-10. Reassess strategy for final rounds based on results. Aim to balance risk and potential profit.

Continue mixed strategy with adjustments. High-value rounds, bid 70-90% of value. Low-value rounds, bid 20-40%. Occasionally bid low (5-10%) for unpredictability. Incorporate a more aggressive approach (90-100%) when value is extremely high. Adjust based on competitors' patterns and round value.

For the next rounds, I'll bid aggressively when my value is above $80, bid my value minus 50% when it's between $40 and $80, and bid very low for values below $40. I'll continue to monitor other bidders' strategies and adjust accordingly.

Plan: Increase bids to 60-80% of value for rounds 9-11, observing competitors' reactions. If still losing, bid aggressively (90-100% of value) for rounds 12-15. Aim to maximize potential profit while balancing risk. Adjust strategy based on round outcomes.

In the next rounds, I will continue with my mixed strategy, but I'll introduce a variable bid adjustment. I'll bid 70-90% of value for high-value rounds, and 20-40% for low-value rounds. I'll also incorporate a random low bid (5-10%) for unpredictability. I'll adjust based on competitors' patterns.

For the next rounds, I'll bid my value when it's above $90. For values between $50 and $90, I'll bid 70% of my value. For values below $50, I'll bid very low to minimize losses. I'll continue to monitor other bidders' strategies.

Plan: Increase bids to 70-80% of value for rounds 10-12. If still losing, bid aggressively (90-100% of value) for rounds 13-15. Aim to maximize potential profit while balancing risk. Adjust strategy based on round outcomes.

I will continue with my mixed strategy but with more adaptive adjustments. High-value rounds, bid 70-80% of value. Low-value rounds, bid 20-30%. Occasionally bid low (5-10%) for unpredictability. Adjust bid based on competitors' patterns and round value.

For the next rounds, I'll bid aggressively only when my value is above $90. For values between $60 and $90, I'll bid 80% of my value. For values below $60, I'll bid very low to minimize losses. I'll continue to monitor other bidders' strategies.

Plan: Increase bids to 80-90% of value for rounds 11-13. If still unsuccessful, bid 100% of value for rounds 14-15. Aim to maximize potential profit while balancing risk. Adjust strategy based on round outcomes.

In the upcoming rounds, I'll bid 60-70% on high-value rounds, 15-25% on low-value rounds, and occasionally bid extremely low (5%) for unpredictability. I'll adjust my strategy based on competitors' patterns and round value.

For the next rounds, I'll bid my value for values above $95. For values between $70 and $95, I'll bid 90% of my value. For values below $70, I'll bid low to minimize losses. I'll continue observing other bidders' strategies.

Plan: Continue bidding 80-90% of value for rounds 12-13. If unsuccessful, bid 100% of value for rounds 14-15. Analyze competitor's bids and if they continue to bid low, adjust strategy to bid slightly above their highest bid to maximize profit.

In the upcoming rounds, I'll experiment with a more aggressive strategy, bidding 90-100% on high-value rounds. I'll maintain a 15-25% bid on low-value rounds and occasionally bid extremely low (5%) for unpredictability. I'll adjust my strategy based on competitors' patterns and round value.

For the next rounds, I'll bid my value for values above $95. For values between $75 and $95, I'll bid 85% of my value. For values below $75, I'll bid extremely low to minimize losses. I'll continue observing other bidders' strategies.

Plan: For round 13, bid 90-100% of value. If unsuccessful, bid 100% for round 14-15. Analyze competitor's bids, adjust strategy to bid slightly above their highest bid to maximize profit. Balance risk and potential profit, adapt strategy based on outcomes.

For the final rounds, I'll pursue a high-risk, high-reward strategy. On high-value rounds, I'll bid aggressively (90-100% of value). On low-value rounds, I'll bid extremely low (5-10% of value) to minimize losses, adjusting based on competitors' patterns.

For the final round, I'll bid aggressively if my value is above $95. For values between $80 and $95, I'll bid 90% of my value. For values below $80, I'll bid very low to minimize losses. This strategy aims to maximize profit while minimizing risk.

Plan: For round 14, bid 90-95% of value. Analyze competitors' highest bids, adjust to bid slightly above. If unsuccessful, bid 100% of value for round 15. Aim to balance risk and potential profit, adapt strategy based on outcomes.

For the final round, I'll bid aggressively (90-100%) if my value is high, aiming to win and maximize profit. If my value is low, I'll bid extremely low (5-10%) to minimize losses. I'll continue to observe competitors' patterns for any last-minute adjustments.
